pullRequest.title: Regenerate Swagger to add IndexParametersConfiguration
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #8908 and #13881
This PR regenerates azure-search-documents codegen layer using the latest Swagger containing the IndexParametersConfiguration model. This adds convenience for setting IndexParameters configuration options using a strongly typed object rather than needing to know the configuration setting names and allowed values.
Here is an APIView which should make it easier to view how APIs have changed since the last GA release. https://apiview.dev/Assemblies/Review/cfc79128b02e458abef5dab5e5475166?diffRevisionId=f0552715cde440e2a4de66de6dffbf3e

commit.message: Regenerate codegen using updated Swagger containing IndexParametersConfiguration
Remove client side validation from codegen
Added custom types into public API and removed converters where possible
Regenerate with codegen constructor Javadoc fix, added RevApi suppressions for new annotations and annotation attributes

nodes.bodyText: @JonathanGiles @srnagar mind taking a look at this change. Models classes are having new annotations and new annotation attributes due to codegen being used instead of the hand-written layer. These annotation changes better represent how the model class should behave but may lead to functional difference.

nodes.bodyText: Is this class a facet query result? if so, we should only explore the getter to user but not the setter.
Just curious, if these were autorest updates for client-side validations that were removed?
